featured.text: Some have saved people from drowning or from burning buildings.
What is the main idea of the passage? (A) William Hunter was a very brave boy. (B) Hunter saved Carnegie from drowning.
In 1886, Carnegie heard about a young man by the name of William Hunter who lost his life trying to save two other boys from drowning.

definition.en_def: To die by submersion in water or another liquid.
definition.example: He almost drowned while swimming in the river.
